subhead: French President Emmanuel Macron and the 90-year-old Palestinian leader announced the creation of a joint committee tasked with drafting a constitution for the future Palestinian state and preparing for general elections.

subhead: If passed by the House of Representatives on Wednesday, a bill could end the government shutdown and at the same time fully restore funding for the food assistance program.

title: Belem embodies the challenges of the Amazon
subhead: Founded in 1616, the city now has 60% of its residents living in informal settlements. As it hosts COP30 in a tightly secured zone, it stands as a symbol of modern Brazil's paradoxes, on the edge of the rainforest.

title: Is the 'body positivity' era coming to an end?
subhead: After a golden period of inclusivity, the tide now appears to be turning in advertising, on runways and in stores. This retreat is causing concern among activists, both in terms of representing diversity and of the mental health of those affected.

title: Who is behind the romance scams on the rise in France?
subhead: Thousands of French people fall victim every year to these scams, orchestrated from massive centers abroad. The scammers, often acting under duress, use sophisticated technologies, making their arrest almost impossible.

She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: The new malaise of civilization: When words, truth and reality fall apart
subhead: The proliferation of wars, increase in mental health disorders, devaluation of speech, and loss of connection to reality are troubling signs of the tipping point our societies are facing. Nearly a century ago, Freud identified a malaise that resonates with what we are going through today.

title: Among France's centrists, Macron's succession is still anyone's game
subhead: A year and a half ahead of the 2027 presidential election, no 'natural' candidate has managed to dominate the fractured former majority coalition. Edouard Philippe, the only declared candidate, has distanced himself from Emmanuel Macron, while Gabriel Attal has held back.
